name: The Anthem
description: The Anthem is a music venue and auditorium located in the Southwest Waterfront neighborhood of Washington, D.C., part of the District Wharf redevelopment. It opened on October 12, 2017, with a performance by The Struts and headlined by the Foo Fighters. This 57,000-square-foot venue, which cost $60 million, features a movable stage and backdrop, allowing for a variable capacity ranging from 2,500 to 6,000. The balconies are closer to the stage than most venues, offering superior views. The Anthem is known for hosting epic rock concerts, lectures, seminars, charity galas, and serves as a unique convention facility and event venue set against DC’s magnificent waterfront. It is operated by I.M.P., an independent concert promotion and production company that also manages other iconic local music venues including the 9:30 Club, Lincoln Theatre, and Merriweather Post Pavilion.
